pullrequest.title: Polaris parameter tweaks, fix for drcsim issue 103

content.raw:
"and introduces more realistic wheel slip" for slippery surfaces, but not for dry ones I think ;) http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fqKOhFrcb4U

the stop and go behaviour is fixed though.
I just tried to set wheel friction to 10 but that already causes the stop&go bug but in addition makes the vehicle drift every time it stops (at very low speeds that a normal car driving on grass/asphalt wouldn't cause to drift that much) so the friction is still too low I guess but already causes the stop&go bug. So the true fix for this issue might be resolving gazebo issue 463?

Also a friction of 1 doesn't allow for any proper control of the vehicle. When using a steering wheel position of 7 the turning radius increases from 3.5m to ~10m or so as it's constantly slipping.
